alert.note: Alert for Blaine; Brown; Custer; Eastern Cherry; Logan; McPherson; Thomas; Western Cherry (Nebraska) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued May 30 at 11:06PM CDT by NWS NorthPlatte
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of southeastern Cherry, southwestern Brown, northern Logan, northeastern McPherson, northwestern Custer, western Blaine and Thomas Counties through 1145 PM CDT... At 1106 PM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from 12 miles east of Valentine National Wildlife Refuge to 16 miles north of Stapleton. Movement was east at 20 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts of 50 to 55 mph and penny size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Thedford, Dunning, Halsey, Purdum, Brownlee, Elsmere, Moon Lake, Hawley Flats, Norway, Koshopah, Natwick and Highway 83 crossing Goose Creek. This includes the following highways... Highway 2 between mile markers 198 and 243. Highway 83 between mile markers 127 and 184. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.75 IN MAX WIND GUST...55 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch remains in effect until midnight CDT for north central and west central Nebraska.

area.areaDesc: Blaine; Brown; Custer; Eastern Cherry; Logan; McPherson; Thomas; Western Cherry
